Mao's view of the worker-peasant alliance was based on the idea of socialist transformation of the whole of agriculture, which is a core principle of communism. This is in contrast to the ideals of the Enlightenment, classical liberalism, and globalization, which are all based on different principles.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
Woman, wake up; the bell of reason is being heard throughout the whole universe; discover your rights. Enslaved man has multiplied his strength, [but] having become free, he has become unjust to his companion. Oh, women, women! When will you cease to be blind? What advantage have you received from the Revolution? A more pronounced scorn, a more marked disdain. If our leaders persist, courageously oppose the force of reason to their empty pretentions of superiority. Regardless of what barriers confront you, it is in your power to free yourselves!
Olympe de Gouges, "Declaration of the Rights of Woman and the Female Citizen," 1791
The independence? Nothing of what I hoped for was achieved. I had expected that my children would be able to have an education, but they did not get it. We were poor peasants then, we are poor peasants now. Nothing has changed. Everything is the same. The only thing is that we are free, the war is over, we work without fear—but apart from that, nothing has changed.
Halima Ghomri, interviewed in the 1970s, after Algeria's war of independence
Which of the following factors is likeliest to have prevented the sort of progress hoped for by the speaker in the second passage?
choice_B: Lack of industrial assets or infrastructure
choice_C: Hostility to women's rights on the part of new elites
choice_D: Prioritization of national liberation over social reform
justification: The speaker in the second passage, Halima Ghomri, is expressing her disappointment that the Algerian war of independence did not bring about the sort of progress she had hoped for. The passage implies that the only thing that changed was that the people were free from oppression, but that other issues such as education and poverty remained the same. The most likely factor that prevented the sort of progress hoped for by the speaker is the prioritization of national liberation over social reform. This is the option (D) in the multiple choice question.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
"The question as to who, and what, is responsible for African underdevelopment can be answered at two levels. Firstly, the answer is that the operation of the imperialist system bears major responsibility for African economic retardation by draining African wealth and by making it impossible to develop more rapidly the resources of the continent. Secondly, one has to deal with those who manipulate the system and those who are either agents or unwitting accomplices of the said system. The capitalists of Western Europe were the ones who actively extended their exploitation from inside Europe to cover the whole of Africa."
Walter Rodney, historian, How Europe Underdeveloped Africa, 1974
Based on your knowledge of world history, which of the following contributed LEAST to Europe's ability to penetrate Africa in the period 1750 to 1900 C.E.?
choice_A: The invention of the machine gun
choice_B: The invention of vaccines for tropical diseases
choice_C: The development of the joint-stock company
justification: The invention of the machine gun did not contribute to Europe's ability to penetrate Africa in the period 1750 to 1900 C.E. The other choices, the invention of vaccines for tropical diseases, the development of the joint-stock company, and the invention of steam-powered ships, all contributed to Europe's ability to penetrate Africa in the period 1750 to 1900 C.E.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
Source 1:
"The Sovereign Congress of Venezuela, to which authority the people of the Republic of the New Granada have voluntarily stood by.
Considering:
1. "That united in a single Republic, the provinces of Venezuela and the New Granada have all proportions and ways to elevate themselves to a higher grade of power and prosperity.
2. "That constituted in separate republics, for any more stronger the ties that these have united them, so far from taking advantages of so many advantages, they would hardly consolidate and make respect their sovereignty.
3. "That these truths, highly penetrated by superior talented men and of an enlightened patriotism, had moved the governments of both republics to convene in a reunion that the vicissitudes of wars decreed and decree the following fundamental Law of the Republic of Colombia:
ARTICLE 1. The Republics of Venezuela and New Granada are from this day on united in a single one under the glorious title of Republic of Colombia….
ARTICLE 4. The Executive Power of the Republic will be vested on the President and in case of his defect a Vice President and his replacement will be appointed interimly by the acting Congress."
Fundamental Law Establishing Gran Colombia, passed by the Congress of Angostura convened by Simon Bolivar, 1819
Source 2:
"IN THE NAME OF THE HOLY TRINITY.
TITLE 1 - Of the Empire of Brazil, its Territories, Government, dynasty, and Religion.
Art. 1. The EMPIRE of Brazil is the political association for all Brazilian citizens. These will form a free and independent nation, and will not form any other union or federation, which may cause it to lose its own Independence.
Art. 2. Its territory is divided into provinces in the form in which it currently finds itself; these may be subdivided, as is required for the good of the state.
Art. 3. Its government is a Hereditary Monarchy, constitutional, and Representative.
Art. 4. The prevailing dynasty is that of the Lord Dom Pedro I, the sitting Emperor and Perpetual Defender of Brazil.
Art. 5. The Catholic Apostolic Roman Religion will continue to be the religion of the Empire. Followers of all other religions are allowed to worship within their households, or particular houses for that intent, so long as there is nothing indicating this on the exterior of the Temple."
Constitution of the Empire of Brazil, March 25, 1824
Which of the following would most undermine the expectations expressed in Article 1 of Source 1?
choice_A: Intervention by the United States and European powers in the independence of Latin American countries
choice_B: Nationalism in Latin America pressing for stronger unity between the former Spanish colonies of South America
choice_C: Slave rebellions fragmenting newly independent Latin American states
choice_D: Sectionalism of elites in the various territories of newly independent Latin American states
justification: Article 1 of Source 1 expresses the expectation that the provinces of Venezuela and the New Granada will be united in a single Republic, and that this union will bring them advantages and prosperity. Sectionalism of elites in the various territories of newly independent Latin American states would undermine this expectation, as it would lead to divisions and conflicts between the different regions, making it difficult to form a unified Republic.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
"We are not Europeans; we are not Indians; we are but a mixed species of aborigines and Spaniards. Americans by birth and Europeans by law, we find ourselves engaged in a dual conflict: we are disputing with the natives for titles of ownership, and at the same time we are struggling to maintain ourselves in the country that gave us birth against the opposition of the invaders. Thus our position is most extraordinary and complicated. But there is more. As our role has always been strictly passive and political existence nil, we find that our quest for liberty is now even more difficult of accomplishment; for we, having been placed in a state lower than slavery, had been robbed not only of our freedom but also of the right to exercise an active domestic tyranny…We have been ruled more by deceit than by force, and we have been degraded more by vice than by superstition. Slavery is the daughter of darkness: an ignorant people is a blind instrument of its own destruction. Ambition and intrigue abuses the credulity and experience of men lacking all political, economic, and civic knowledge; they adopt pure illusion as reality; they take license for liberty, treachery for patriotism, and vengeance for justice. If a people, perverted by their training, succeed in achieving their liberty, they will soon lose it, for it would be of no avail to endeavor to explain to them that happiness consists in the practice of virtue; that the rule of law is more powerful than the rule of tyrants, because, as the laws are more inflexible, every one should submit to their beneficent austerity; that proper morals, and not force, are the bases of law; and that to practice justice is to practice liberty."
Simón de Bolívar, Message to the Congress of Angostura, 1819
The passage is best understood in the context of which of the following political movements?
choice_A: The fight for workers' rights in Central America
choice_B: The fight for independence in South America
choice_C: The fight for economic justice in the Caribbean
choice_D: The fight for political autonomy in the Philippines
justification: The passage is best understood in the context of the fight for independence in South America. Simón de Bolívar was a Venezuelan military and political leader who led the struggle for independence in the Spanish colonies of South America. In his Message to the Congress of Angostura, he discussed the difficult position of the people of South America, who were of mixed descent and were struggling to maintain their freedom against the Spanish invaders. He argued that the people of South America had been robbed of their freedom and were being ruled by deceit rather than force, and that they needed to practice justice and virtue in order to achieve their liberty.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
Meng Yizi asked about the treatment of parents. The Master said, "Never disobey!" When Fan Chi was driving his carriage for him, [he asked], "In what sense did you mean this?" The Master said, "While they are alive, serve them according to proper ritual. When they die, bury them according to proper ritual, and sacrifice to them according to proper ritual."
Confucius, The Analects, Book 2, Chapter 5
In China and the regions it influenced, Confucian teachings like the one above were used politically for which of the following purposes?
choice_B: To justify war against neighboring states
justification: Confucius' teachings, as seen in the passage, were used to reinforce social hierarchy in China and the regions it influenced. The passage states that one should serve their parents according to proper ritual while they are alive, bury them according to proper ritual, and sacrifice to them according to proper ritual. This reinforces the idea of filial piety, which is a cornerstone of Confucianism and is used to reinforce the social hierarchy. The other choices are not related to the passage.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
"And then Shapur, King of Kings, passed away. Then his son Hormizd, King of Kings, rose over the empire. And Hormizd, King of Kings, conferred on me cap and belt and created for me a higher rank and dignity, and at court and in kingdom after kingdom, place after place, throughout the whole empire he gave me more authority and power in matters of the divine services, and created for me the title "Kerdir, Ahura Mazda's [Chief Priest]" after the name of Ahura Mazda, the Deity. And thereupon in kingdom after kingdom, place after place, many divine services were performed in magnificence, and many Warham fires were established, and many magi became happy and prosperous, and many fires and magi were imperially installed…
And then Hormizd, King of Kings, passed away. Then Bahram, King of Kings, son of Shapur, King of Kings, and brother of Hormizd, King of Kings, rose over the empire. And Bahram, King of Kings, also held me in high honor and dignity and at court and in kingdom after kingdom, place after place, gave me authority and power for divine services of every sort. And thereupon in kingdom after kingdom, place after place, many divine services were performed in magnificence and many Warharan fires were established, and many magi became happy and prosperous, and many fires and magi were imperially installed…
And in kingdom after kingdom and place after place throughout the whole empire the services of Ahura Mazda and the gods became preeminent, and great dignity came to the Mazdayanian religion and the magi in the empire, and the gods and water and fire and small cattle in the empire attained great satisfaction, while Ahriman [the evil counterpart to Ahura Mazda] and the demons were punished and rebuked, and the teachings of Ahriman and the demons departed from the empire and were abandoned. And Jews, Buddhists, Hindus, Nasoreans [Orthodox Christians], Christians, Maktak [Baptists], and Manichaeans in the empire were smitten, and destruction of idols and scattering of the stores of the demons and god-seats and nests was abandoned."
Excerpt from the inscription of Kerdir at Naqsh-e-Rustam, Persia, late third century C.E.
The source best supports which of the following inferences about sources of political authority in the period circa 600 B.C.E.–600 C.E.?
choice_A: Rulers derived legitimacy for their rule by their sponsorship of religion and chief priests.
choice_B: Rulers were limited in their political authority by powerful religious figures.
choice_C: Rulers derived legitimacy for their rule through victories over foreign peoples.
choice_D: Rulers derived legitimacy for their rule through the consent of those they governed.
justification: The source best supports the inference that rulers derived legitimacy for their rule by their sponsorship of religion and chief priests. This is evidenced by the fact that Shapur, Hormizd, and Bahram, all Kings of Kings, conferred upon Kerdir, the Chief Priest, cap and belt, higher rank and dignity, and authority and power for divine services. This indicates that the rulers of the period circa 600 B.C.E.–600 C.E. derived legitimacy for their rule by their sponsorship of religion and chief priests.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
O ye who believe! Strong drink and games of chance and idols… are only an infamy of Satan's handiwork. Leave it aside in order that ye may succeed.
the Qur'an, Sura 5: 89
When once you hear the roses are in bloom,
Then is the time, my love, to pour the wine.
the Rubáiyát of Omar Khayyám
Both verses relate most closely to
choice_A: key economic processes within Islamic society.
choice_B: production of food and drink in Islamic society.
choice_C: religious regulation of personal behavior in Islamic society.
choice_D: changing gender relations in Islamic society.
justification: The verse from the Qur'an is a religious regulation of personal behavior in Islamic society, as it instructs believers to avoid strong drink, games of chance, and idols. The verse from the Rubáiyát of Omar Khayyám also relates to religious regulation of personal behavior in Islamic society, as it encourages the pouring of wine, which is prohibited in the Qur'an. Therefore, the correct answer is (C).

question:
This question refers to the following information.
"Thereupon it was declared by the above-mentioned representatives of the aforesaid King and Queen of Castile, Leon, Aragon, Sicily, Granada, etc., and of the aforesaid King of Portugal and the Algarves, etc.:
[I.] That, whereas a certain controversy exists between the said lords, their constituents, as to what lands, of all those discovered in the ocean sea up to the present day, the date of this treaty, pertain to each one of the said parts respectively; therefore, for the sake of peace and concord, and for the preservation of the relationship and love of the said King of Portugal for the said King and Queen of Castile, Aragon, etc., it being the pleasure of their Highnesses, they, their said representatives, acting in their name and by virtue of their powers herein described, covenanted and agreed that a boundary or straight line be determined and drawn north and south, from pole to pole, on the said ocean sea, from the Arctic to the Antarctic pole. This boundary or line shall be drawn straight, as aforesaid, at a distance of three hundred and seventy leagues west of the Cape Verde Islands, being calculated by degrees, or by any other manner as may be considered the best and readiest, provided the distance shall be no greater than abovesaid. And all lands, both islands and mainlands, found and discovered already, or to be found and discovered hereafter, by the said King of Portugal and by his vessels on this side of the said line and bound determined as above, toward the east, in either north or south latitude, on the eastern side of the said bound provided the said bound is not crossed, shall belong to, and remain in the possession of, and pertain forever to, the said King of Portugal and his successors. And all other lands, both islands and mainlands, found or to be found hereafter, discovered or to be discovered hereafter, which have been discovered or shall be discovered by the said King and Queen of Castile, Aragon, etc., and by their vessels, on the western side of the said bound, determined as above, after having passed the said bound toward the west, in either its north or south latitude, shall belong to, and remain in the possession of, and pertain forever to, the said King and Queen of Castile, Leon, etc., and to their successors."
Treaty of Tordesillas, 1494
Which of the following historical developments provides the best context for the treaty above?
choice_B: European engagement in the African slave trade
justification: The Treaty of Tordesillas was signed in 1494 between the Kingdoms of Portugal and Castile in order to resolve a dispute over the newly discovered lands in the Atlantic Ocean. The treaty established a boundary line between the two countries, with all lands to the east of the line belonging to Portugal and all lands to the west belonging to Castile. This treaty was a result of the European maritime exploration of the Atlantic Ocean, which had begun in the 15th century. Therefore, the best context for the treaty is European maritime exploration.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
At the peak of their power, the domains of the Mongol khans, or rulers, made up a vast realm in which once-hostile peoples lived together in peace and virtually all religions were tolerated. . . . The law code first promulgated by Chinggis Khan ordered human interaction. The result was an important new stage in international contact. From eastern Europe to southern China, merchants and travelers could move across the well-policed Mongol domains without fear for their lives or property. The great swath of Mongol territory that covered or connected most of Europe, Asia, and the Middle East served as a bridge between the civilizations of the Eastern Hemisphere. The caravans and embassies that crossed the Mongol lands transmitted new food, inventions, and ideas from one civilized pool to others and from civilized pools to the nomadic peoples who served as intermediaries. Secure trade routes made for prosperous merchants and wealthy, cosmopolitan cities. They also facilitated the spread of foods [and] inventions . . . a major force for economic and social development and the enhancement of civilized life.
—Robert Guisepi, 1992
Which statement most accurately compares the Mongol (post-classical) empire with the Persian (classical) empire?
choice_A: Both the Mongols and the Persians allowed conquered peoples to maintain their local traditions and cultures.
choice_B: The Mongols invested in building large-scale monuments, whereas the Persians focused on public works.
choice_C: Both the Persians and the Mongols improved the social, economic, and legal status of women.
choice_D: The Mongols created a new syncretic belief system, but the Persians maintained a traditional monotheistic religion.
justification: A is the correct answer because both the Mongols and the Persians allowed conquered peoples to maintain their local traditions and cultures. The Mongols were known for their tolerance of different religions and cultures, while the Persians were known for their tolerance of different ethnicities and religions. Both empires also improved the social, economic, and legal status of women. However, the Mongols did not invest in building large-scale monuments, and the Persians did not create a new syncretic belief system.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
Is it not unity alone that can weld us into an effective force, capable of creating our own progress and making our valuable contribution to world peace? Which independent African state will claim that its financial structure and banking institutions are fully harnessed to its national development? Which will claim that its material resources and human energies are available for its own national aspirations? We are fast learning that political independence is not enough to rid us of the consequences of colonial rule. We have been too busy nursing our separate states to understand fully the basic need for union, rooted in common purpose, common planning and common endeavour.
Ghana's president, Kwame Nkrumah, addressing the Organization of African Unity, 1963
Which of the following factors was most important in preventing the fulfillment of the political dreams described in the passage?
choice_A: A lack of common ethnicity, language, or religion
choice_B: The spread of communism throughout the continent
choice_C: Armed intervention on the part of the Cold War superpowers
justification: The passage describes the need for African states to unite in order to create progress and contribute to world peace. However, the political dreams described in the passage were prevented from being fulfilled due to the Cold War superpowers intervening in African affairs. This intervention prevented African states from uniting and achieving their political goals. Therefore, the correct answer is (C) Armed intervention on the part of the Cold War superpowers.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
"Let a woman retire late to bed, but rise early to duties; let her nor dread tasks by day or by night. Let her not refuse to perform domestic duties whether easy or difficult. That which must be done, let her finish completely, tidily, and systematically, When a woman follows such rules as these, then she may be said to be industrious.
Let a woman be correct in manner and upright in character in order to serve her husband. Let her live in purity and quietness of spirit, and attend to her own affairs. Let her love not gossip and silly laughter. Let her cleanse and purify and arrange in order the wine and the food for the offerings to the ancestors. When a woman observes such principles as these, then she may be said to continue ancestral worship.
No woman who observes these three fundamentals of life has ever had a bad reputation or has fallen into disgrace. If a woman fail to observe them, how can her name be honored; how can she but bring disgrace upon herself?"
© The East Asian Library and the Gest Collection, Princeton University.
Ban Zhao, Lessons for a Woman, ca. 80 C.E.
Which theme in the passage was common in patriarchal ancient societies?
choice_A: The importance of attending to the affairs of others
choice_C: The importance of systematically arranging wine
justification: The passage is from the ancient Chinese text "Lessons for a Woman" by Ban Zhao, which was written in a patriarchal society. The passage emphasizes the importance of female purity, as well as other duties such as domestic duties, attending to her own affairs, and ancestor worship. Therefore, the correct answer is (D) The importance of female purity.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
"The question as to who, and what, is responsible for African underdevelopment can be answered at two levels. Firstly, the answer is that the operation of the imperialist system bears major responsibility for African economic retardation by draining African wealth and by making it impossible to develop more rapidly the resources of the continent. Secondly, one has to deal with those who manipulate the system and those who are either agents or unwitting accomplices of the said system. The capitalists of Western Europe were the ones who actively extended their exploitation from inside Europe to cover the whole of Africa."
Walter Rodney, historian, How Europe Underdeveloped Africa, 1974
Rodney's argument in the passage is most likely a response to which of the following developments of the period 1450 to 1750 C.E.?
choice_A: The colonization of the interior of Africa by European powers
choice_B: The expansion of the African diaspora to the New World
choice_C: The spread of Christianity into Sub-Saharan Africa
choice_D: The importation of New World products into Africa
justification: Walter Rodney's argument in the passage is most likely a response to the colonization of the interior of Africa by European powers during the period 1450 to 1750 C.E. He argues that the imperialist system is responsible for African economic retardation and that the capitalists of Western Europe were the ones who actively extended their exploitation from inside Europe to cover the whole of Africa. This is a direct response to the colonization of the interior of Africa by European powers during this period.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
Oh, shame on you, poor Winter King!
What's this that you have done?
Is 't not a very naughty thing
To snatch the kaiser's crown?
Now you will have to stay away
Alike from Rhine and Prague,
And more than that-shame and dismay
Your days and nights will plague.
Right well you knew, and all the world,
Right well they know this thing,
That Ferdinand alone can be
Bohemia's lawful king.
So come, dear Fritz, rouse up and go
To Ferdinand, your king,
And beg him graciously to show
Full pardon for your sin.
"Poor Winter King," seventeenth-century song
Which of the following is an important underlying issue in this song?
justification: The song is about the Winter King, Frederick V of the Palatinate, who was deposed from the throne of Bohemia by the Habsburg Emperor Ferdinand II. The underlying issue in the song is the rules of royal succession, as Ferdinand II was the rightful heir to the throne of Bohemia according to the rules of succession.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
Woman, wake up; the bell of reason is being heard throughout the whole universe; discover your rights. Enslaved man has multiplied his strength, [but] having become free, he has become unjust to his companion. Oh, women, women! When will you cease to be blind? What advantage have you received from the Revolution? A more pronounced scorn, a more marked disdain. If our leaders persist, courageously oppose the force of reason to their empty pretentions of superiority. Regardless of what barriers confront you, it is in your power to free yourselves!
Olympe de Gouges, "Declaration of the Rights of Woman and the Female Citizen," 1791
The independence? Nothing of what I hoped for was achieved. I had expected that my children would be able to have an education, but they did not get it. We were poor peasants then, we are poor peasants now. Nothing has changed. Everything is the same. The only thing is that we are free, the war is over, we work without fear—but apart from that, nothing has changed.
Halima Ghomri, interviewed in the 1970s, after Algeria's war of independence
Based on both passages, which of the following conclusions can be most reasonably made about revolutions?
choice_A: The new liberties gained by revolution are rarely worth the bloodshed.
choice_B: The new liberties gained by revolution typically fail to benefit women or ethnic minorities.
choice_C: The new liberties gained by revolution are sometimes distributed unequally or inconsistently.
choice_D: The new liberties gained by revolution do not always bring about economic improvement.
justification: Both passages suggest that the new liberties gained by revolution are sometimes distributed unequally or inconsistently. Olympe de Gouges argues that women have not received any advantage from the Revolution, and Halima Ghomri states that nothing has changed for her family despite the war of independence being over. Therefore, the most reasonable conclusion to draw from both passages is that the new liberties gained by revolution are sometimes distributed unequally or inconsistently.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
"My little homestead in the city, which I recently insured for ￡2,000 would no doubt have shared the common fate, as the insurance companies will not make good that which is destroyed by the Queen's enemies. And although I have a farm of 50 acres close to the town, no doubt the crops and premises would have been destroyed. In fact, this has already partly been the case, and I am now suing the Government for damages done by a contingent of 1,500 natives that have recently encamped not many hundred yards from the place, who have done much damage all around."
Letter from a British citizen to his sister during the Anglo-Zulu War, South Africa, 1879
Which of the following reasons explains why European citizens moved in large numbers to Zulu lands in 1867?
choice_A: The British crown offered incentives to those who would establish homesteads in the unsettled lands of South Africa.
choice_B: The Zulu created attractive trade ports along the Indian Ocean.
choice_C: The Berlin Conference clarified boundaries, thus making it logistically sound for Europeans to move to the African colonies.
choice_D: A diamond rush ensued following the discovery of diamonds on Zulu lands.
justification: The correct answer is (A) The British crown offered incentives to those who would establish homesteads in the unsettled lands of South Africa. This is evidenced by the letter from the British citizen to his sister, which mentions that he has a homestead in the city that he recently insured for ￡2,000. This suggests that he was encouraged to move to the area by the British crown, which offered incentives to those who would establish homesteads in the unsettled lands of South Africa. The other choices are not relevant to the context of the letter.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
"When the gods fashioned Gilgamesh*, to him they gave a perfect form. The glorious sun Shamash bestowed upon him glory; Adad the terrible god of storms bestowed upon him courage. The great gods perfected his magnificence beyond all others, terrible like the great wild bull. Two thirds god they made him; one third man they made him.
Of Uruk, its great rampart he built, and the wall of the sacred Eanna temple, the holy sanctuary. Behold the outer walls which gleam with the brilliance of copper; see the inner wall which none might rival. Touch the threshold stone—it is from ancient days. Goest thou into the Eanna temple, yea, the dwelling place of Ishtar, the like of which no subsequent king or living man might equal. Ascend and walk about on the wall of Uruk, inspect the corner-stone, and examine its brick-work, whether its wall is not made of burned brick, and its foundation laid by the Seven Sages. One third for city, one third for garden, one third for field, and a precinct for the temple of Ishtar. These parts and the precinct comprise Uruk."
The Epic of Gilgamesh, ca. 2100 B.C.E.
*Gilgamesh was a king of Uruk.
Which of the following statements about ancient cities is most supported by the discussion of Uruk in the second paragraph?
choice_A: Ancient cities lacked effective fortifications against attack.
choice_B: Ancient cities featured areas for worshipping their patron deities.
choice_C: Ancient cities commonly decorated their temples in modest ways.
choice_D: Ancient cities featured areas for training their armies.
justification: The second paragraph of the passage discusses the city of Uruk, which was ruled by Gilgamesh. It mentions the outer and inner walls of the city, the threshold stone, and the Eanna temple, which was the dwelling place of Ishtar. This indicates that ancient cities featured areas for worshipping their patron deities, making (B) the correct answer.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
Whether the question be to continue or to discontinue the practice of sati, the decision is equally surrounded by an awful responsibility. To consent to the consignment year after year of hundreds of innocent victims to a cruel and untimely end, when the power exists of preventing it, is a predicament which no conscience can contemplate without horror. But, on the other hand, to put to hazard by a contrary course the very safety of the British Empire in India is an alternative which itself may be considered a still greater evil. When we had powerful neighbours and greater reason to doubt our own security, expediency might recommend a more cautious proceeding, but now that we are supreme my opinion is decidedly in favour of an open and general prohibition.
William Bentinck, Govenor-General of India, "On the Suppression of Sati," 1829
I have made it my study to examine the nature and character of the Indians [who trade with us], and however repugnant it may be to our feelings, I am convinced they must be ruled with a rod of iron, to bring and keep them in a proper state of subordination, and the most certain way to effect this is by letting them feel their dependence on [the foodstuffs and manufactured goods we sell them].
George Simpson, Head of Northern Department, Hudson's Bay Company, 1826
Which of the following resources would the author of the second passage have been most likely interested in obtaining from local natives?
justification: The author of the second passage, George Simpson, was the Head of the Northern Department of the Hudson's Bay Company. This company was primarily interested in obtaining furs from local natives, so the correct answer is (D) Furs.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
"The question as to who, and what, is responsible for African underdevelopment can be answered at two levels. Firstly, the answer is that the operation of the imperialist system bears major responsibility for African economic retardation by draining African wealth and by making it impossible to develop more rapidly the resources of the continent. Secondly, one has to deal with those who manipulate the system and those who are either agents or unwitting accomplices of the said system. The capitalists of Western Europe were the ones who actively extended their exploitation from inside Europe to cover the whole of Africa."
Walter Rodney, historian, How Europe Underdeveloped Africa, 1974
Which of the following best explains the importance of trading contacts with Europeans for Sub-Saharan Africans in the period 1450 to 1750 C.E.?
choice_A: Sub-Saharan Africans relied on European merchants to sustain population growth through the constant importation of New World foodstuffs.
choice_B: Sub-Saharan Africans consolidated new states and kingdoms by trading with the Europeans for firearms.
choice_C: Sub-Saharan Africans depended on European merchants as the sole purchasers of slaves.
choice_D: Sub-Saharan Africans allied with European powers to evict Muslim and Arab merchant princes from encroaching on their sovereignty.
justification: The question is asking about the importance of trading contacts with Europeans for Sub-Saharan Africans in the period 1450 to 1750 C.E. The answer is (B) Sub-Saharan Africans consolidated new states and kingdoms by trading with the Europeans for firearms. This is because trading with Europeans allowed Sub-Saharan Africans to acquire firearms, which allowed them to consolidate new states and kingdoms. This is in contrast to the information provided in the passage, which explains how the imperialist system of Europe was responsible for African economic retardation.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
"At least one of the [world's] societies would have to somehow enormously increase its productivity [in order to achieve global hegemony]. That quantum jump would have to be made before the various scientific, technological, agricultural, and industrial revolutions on which our post-quantum-leap world rests. It could only be accomplished by exploiting the ecosystems, mineral resources, and human assets of whole continents outside the lands of the society making the jump. Western Europe did just that by means of its brutality and guns and, more important, by geographical and ecological luck."
Copyright © 2015 Cambridge University Press.
Alfred Crosby, historian, Ecological Imperialism, 2004
Crosby's argument in the passage is most likely a response to which of the following developments of the period 1450–1750 C.E.?
choice_A: The development of direct trade links between Western Europe and India
choice_B: The beginning of the Industrial Revolution
choice_C: The colonization of North and South America by Western Europeans
choice_D: The increasing development of seafaring technologies
justification: In the passage, Alfred Crosby is arguing that Western Europe was able to achieve global hegemony by exploiting the ecosystems, mineral resources, and human assets of whole continents outside the lands of the society making the jump. This is a reference to the colonization of North and South America by Western Europeans, which occurred during the period 1450–1750 C.E. Therefore, the correct answer is (C).

question:
This question refers to the following information.
Source 1:
"We proclaim Him also by our senses on all sides, and we sanctify the noblest sense, which is that of sight. The image is a memorial, just what words are to a listening ear. What a book is to the literate, that an image is to the illiterate. The image speaks to the sight as words to the ear; it brings us understanding."
John of Damascus, Apologia Against Those Who Decry Holy Images, ca. 730 C.E.
Source 2:
"To make our confession short, we keep unchanged all the ecclesiastical traditions handed down to us, whether in writing or verbally, one of which is the making of pictorial representations, agreeable to the history of the preaching of the Gospel, a tradition useful in many respects, but especially in this, that so the incarnation of the Word of God is shown forth as real and not merely fantastic, for these have mutual indications and without doubt have also mutual significations."
Decree of the Second Council of Nicaea, 787 C.E.
Which of the following religious movements was ideologically opposed to the sentiments about the use of holy images reflected in the passages?
justification: The passages from John of Damascus and the Second Council of Nicaea both reflect a positive attitude towards the use of holy images. This is in contrast to the beliefs of Sunni Islam, which is ideologically opposed to the use of holy images. The other choices, Buddhism, Zoroastrianism, and Jainism, do not have a specific stance on the use of holy images.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
Yi Yin sacrificed to the former king, and presented the heir-king reverently before the shrine of his grandfather. . . . Yi Yin then clearly described the virtue of the Meritorious Ancestor for the instruction of the young king.
"Oh! of old the former kings of Xia cultivated earnestly their virtue, and then there were no calamities from Heaven. The spirits of the hills and rivers were all in tranquility; and the birds and beasts enjoyed their existence according to their nature. But their descendant did not follow their example, and Heaven sent down calamities, using our ruler, who possessed of its favor. The attack on Xia may be traced to the orgies in Ming Tiao. . . . Our king of Shang brilliantly displayed his sagely prowess; for oppression he substituted his generous gentleness. Now your Majesty is entering on the inheritance of his virtue; all depends on how you commence your reign.
"Oh! the former king began with careful attention to the bonds that hold men together. . . . Revere these warnings in your person. . . . The ways of Heaven are not invariable: on the good-doer it sends down all blessings, and on the evil-doer it sends down all miseries. If you not be virtuous, be it in large things or in small, it will bring the ruin of your ancestral temple."
—Excerpted and adapted from the Shu Jing, 6th century BCE, China
Which of the following best supports the importance of ancestor worship in China during the period 600 BCE to 600 CE?
choice_A: Former kings of Xia cultivated earnestly their virtue, and then there were no calamities from Heaven.
choice_B: It will bring the ruin of your ancestral temple.
choice_C: Presented the heir-king reverently before the shrine of his grandfather.
choice_D: The former king began with careful attention to the bonds that hold men together.
justification: Option C is the best choice to support the importance of ancestor worship in China during the period 600 BCE to 600 CE. In the passage, Yi Yin presented the heir-king reverently before the shrine of his grandfather, which shows the importance of ancestor worship in China during this period.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
"My little homestead in the city, which I recently insured for ￡2,000 would no doubt have shared the common fate, as the insurance companies will not make good that which is destroyed by the Queen's enemies. And although I have a farm of 50 acres close to the town, no doubt the crops and premises would have been destroyed. In fact, this has already partly been the case, and I am now suing the Government for damages done by a contingent of 1,500 natives that have recently encamped not many hundred yards from the place, who have done much damage all around."
Letter from a British citizen to his sister during the Anglo-Zulu War, South Africa, 1879
Which of the following was a direct effect of the expanding British presence in South Africa in the late nineteenth century?
choice_A: South Africa became the most economically successful of all the British colonies.
choice_B: Great Britain was penalized at the Berlin Conference with a loss of land.
choice_C: The British engaged in a war with South African decedents of the Dutch.
choice_D: British settlers created an independent nation.
justification: The correct answer is C, as the letter from the British citizen to his sister during the Anglo-Zulu War in South Africa in 1879 references a war between the British and South African decedents of the Dutch. This war was a direct effect of the expanding British presence in South Africa in the late nineteenth century. The other choices are incorrect as they do not accurately reflect the effects of the British presence in South Africa.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
Oh, shame on you, poor Winter King!
What's this that you have done?
Is 't not a very naughty thing
To snatch the kaiser's crown?
Now you will have to stay away
Alike from Rhine and Prague,
And more than that-shame and dismay
Your days and nights will plague.
Right well you knew, and all the world,
Right well they know this thing,
That Ferdinand alone can be
Bohemia's lawful king.
So come, dear Fritz, rouse up and go
To Ferdinand, your king,
And beg him graciously to show
Full pardon for your sin.
"Poor Winter King," seventeenth-century song
The narrator of the song would most likely identify as which of the following?
justification: The song is about the Winter King, Frederick V of the Palatinate, who was a Protestant. The narrator of the song is likely to be Protestant as well.

question:
This question refers to the following information.
At the peak of their power, the domains of the Mongol khans, or rulers, made up a vast realm in which once-hostile peoples lived together in peace and virtually all religions were tolerated. . . . The law code first promulgated by Chinggis Khan ordered human interaction. The result was an important new stage in international contact. From eastern Europe to southern China, merchants and travelers could move across the well-policed Mongol domains without fear for their lives or property. The great swath of Mongol territory that covered or connected most of Europe, Asia, and the Middle East served as a bridge between the civilizations of the Eastern Hemisphere. The caravans and embassies that crossed the Mongol lands transmitted new food, inventions, and ideas from one civilized pool to others and from civilized pools to the nomadic peoples who served as intermediaries. Secure trade routes made for prosperous merchants and wealthy, cosmopolitan cities. They also facilitated the spread of foods [and] inventions . . . a major force for economic and social development and the enhancement of civilized life.
—Robert Guisepi, 1992
The legacies or adaptations of legacies from the Mongol empire are varied. Most notably, they include which of the following selections?
justification: The passage states that the Mongol empire was characterized by religious tolerance, which allowed for the spread of ideas, inventions, and foods from one civilization to another. This religious tolerance is one of the legacies or adaptations of legacies from the Mongol empire. The other choices (A, B, and C) are not mentioned in the passage and are therefore not legacies or adaptations of legacies from the Mongol empire.

question: The environmental design that brings pets and plants to nursing homes and young people and children as regular visitors is referred to as
justification: The Eden Alternative is an environmental design that brings pets and plants to nursing homes and encourages regular visits from young people and children. This design is intended to reduce loneliness and boredom among residents and to create a more stimulating and engaging environment.

question: The slowing that occurs with advanced age appears to be centered in
justification: The slowing that occurs with advanced age appears to be centered in the brain, as the brain's ability to process information and recall memories decreases with age. This can lead to slower reaction times, difficulty with multitasking, and difficulty with learning new information.

question: When damage to the brain is irreversible and increasing we refer to the disorder as
justification: Dementia is a term used to describe a group of symptoms associated with a decline in cognitive functioning that is severe enough to interfere with a person's daily life. It is characterized by irreversible and progressive damage to the brain, resulting in memory loss, confusion, and difficulty with communication and problem-solving.

question: Older adults are able to improve their memories and reduce their anxiety about declining memory when
choice_A: They learn about memory and aging and learn some techniques
choice_B: They simply learn a number of memory improvement techniques
choice_C: They learn that many aspects of memory do not decline and some even get better
choice_D: Older adults cannot do either of these
justification: Option A is the correct answer because it states that older adults can improve their memories and reduce their anxiety about declining memory when they learn about memory and aging and learn some techniques. Options B, C, and D are incorrect because they do not provide any information about how older adults can improve their memories and reduce their anxiety about declining memory.

question: Before we can collect data from other human beings we must make sure that they
choice_A: Have information that will be worth our effort to collect
choice_B: Are going to be honest and forthright
choice_C: Are informed about our study and give their consent to participate
choice_D: Have been granted permission to participate by the IRB
justification: Before we can collect data from other human beings we must make sure that they are informed about our study and give their consent to participate. This is an important ethical consideration and is often regulated by an Institutional Review Board (IRB).

question: A researcher who wants to examine both age and cohort differences is advised to use a _____ design.
justification: A cross-sequential design is a type of research design that combines elements of both cross-sectional and longitudinal designs. It is used to examine both age and cohort differences, as it allows researchers to compare different age groups at different points in time.

question: The strongest research technique for determining genetic contributions to longevity is to compare
justification: The strongest research technique for determining genetic contributions to longevity is to compare identical and fraternal twins. Identical twins share the same genetic makeup, while fraternal twins share only half of their genetic makeup. By comparing the longevity of identical and fraternal twins, researchers can determine the extent to which genetics play a role in longevity.

question: Which of the following is one of McAdam's levels of personality?
justification: McAdam's levels of personality include Control, Identity, Intimacy, Generativity, and Assimilation. Therefore, the correct answer is (B) Identity.

question: The total number of people who have some disorder divided by the total number of people gives you the ____ rate.
justification: The correct answer is (A) Prevalence. Prevalence is a measure of the total number of people who have a disorder divided by the total number of people in a population. Incidence is a measure of the number of new cases of a disorder in a population over a given period of time. Incipient refers to the early stages of a disorder or disease. Diseased is not a statistical measure.

question: Grandparents with grandchildren in college report feeling especially loved when such grandchildren
choice_A: Ask about their satisfaction with life and offer to help
choice_B: Visit during the holidays and bring gifts
choice_C: Pay a surprise visit and ask for advice
choice_D: Invite the grandparents over to their place and cook a good meal
justification: Grandparents with grandchildren in college report feeling especially loved when such grandchildren invite them over to their place and cook a good meal. This is a way for the grandchildren to show their appreciation for their grandparents and to spend quality time with them. Other possible choices, such as asking about their satisfaction with life and offering to help, visiting during the holidays and bringing gifts, and paying a surprise visit and asking for advice, are all nice gestures, but they do not necessarily show the same level of appreciation as inviting the grandparents over and cooking a meal.

question: Which leg of the three-legged stool do most retirees have
justification: The most common leg of the three-legged stool for retirees is Social Security. Pension plans, savings, and assets are also important components of retirement planning, but Social Security is the most common source of income for retirees.

question: Those more likely to experience depression after a loss are those who
choice_C: Have been married more than 40 years
justification: Those more likely to experience depression after a loss are those who have not previously experienced depression. This is because those who have not previously experienced depression may not have the coping skills or resources to effectively manage the emotions associated with the loss.

question: One difference that seems to be mostly cohort rather than age is the difference in ____ for different age groups
justification: The correct answer is (D) Personality traits. This is because the differences in personality traits between different age groups is largely due to the different experiences and values of the different cohorts, rather than the age of the individuals. Coping strategies, work productivity, and rates of dementia are all more likely to be affected by age than by cohort.

question: An older adult who has received a message (e.g., it's going to rain tomorrow) would be most likely to remember what when telling another person?
choice_A: The person who told them it would rain
choice_B: Where they were when they received the message
choice_D: The time of day that the message was received
justification: The older adult would be most likely to remember the contents of the message when telling another person. The other choices are not relevant to the task of relaying the message.

question: The largest proportion of older adults living alone reside in
justification: According to the U.S. Census Bureau, the state with the largest proportion of older adults living alone is Florida, with nearly 20% of its population aged 65 and over living alone. Hawaii, Washington, DC, and California all have lower proportions of older adults living alone, with Hawaii having the lowest at just over 11%.

question: What percentage of older adults report feeling very or often lonely?
justification: According to a 2018 survey by the AARP, 25% of adults aged 65 and older reported feeling very or often lonely.

question: A difference between the social networks of older and younger adults is that older adults have
justification: Older adults tend to have larger inner circles of close friends and family, while younger adults tend to have larger outer circles of acquaintances.

question: Typically the longest phase of grieving is which of the following?
justification: The longest phase of grieving is typically the Disorganization and Despair phase. This phase is characterized by intense emotions, confusion, and difficulty functioning. During this phase, the individual may feel overwhelmed, helpless, and hopeless. They may also experience physical symptoms such as fatigue, insomnia, and changes in appetite.

question: The program that takes over care for those with 6 or fewer months to live, attempts to keep them at home, provides pain relief, and ends all life-prolonging technologies is called
justification: The program that takes over care for those with 6 or fewer months to live, attempts to keep them at home, provides pain relief, and ends all life-prolonging technologies is called Hospice. Euthanasia is the practice of intentionally ending a life to relieve pain and suffering, while cryonics is the practice of preserving a body at very low temperatures in order to potentially revive it in the future. Medicare is a health insurance program for people over 65 and those with certain disabilities.

question: People with which of the following forms of control are least likely to have accessibility problems where they live?
justification: People with total control are least likely to have accessibility problems where they live. Total control means that the person has complete control over their living environment, including the ability to make changes to the space to make it more accessible. This is in contrast to external, internal, and primary control, which involve relying on outside sources to make changes to the living environment.

question: Which of the following hormones has not yet been claimed to ward off senescence?
justification: Viasterol has not yet been claimed to ward off senescence, while DHEA, human growth hormone, and melatonin have all been claimed to have anti-aging properties.

question: Research has offered some longitudinal as well as cross sectional support for the theory put forth by
justification: The theory put forth by Levenson has been supported by both longitudinal and cross sectional research.

question: Older workers are more likely to
justification: Older workers are more likely to be laid off than younger workers due to their higher salaries and the fact that they are often seen as less productive than younger workers.

question: One reason that older adults show high levels of optimism is that
choice_A: Many pessimists die at a younger age
choice_B: They do not really know what is going on
choice_C: This may be a warning sign for dementia
justification: A is the correct answer because older adults tend to show higher levels of optimism due to their life experience and the fact that many pessimists die at a younger age. This leaves the older population with a higher proportion of optimists.

question: Identity refers to one's
choice_A: Use of a particular coping strategy
choice_B: Control over one's own life story
justification: Identity refers to one's coherent sense of self, which includes physical appearance and overall personality, as well as control over one's own life story and the use of particular coping strategies.

question: The idea that the ability to complete a task depends on the fit between the environment and the person undertaking the task is a basic tenet of which of the following theories of aging?
justification: The idea that the ability to complete a task depends on the fit between the environment and the person undertaking the task is a basic tenet of the Congruence Theory of Aging. This theory suggests that the ability to successfully complete a task is dependent on the individual's ability to adapt to the environment and the environment's ability to accommodate the individual's needs.

question: High levels of social support are strongly associated with
justification: High levels of social support are strongly associated with increased longevity, as social support has been linked to better physical and mental health outcomes.

question: The term "senescence" refers to
justification: The term "senescence" refers to the biological aging process, which is the gradual deterioration of physical and mental abilities that occurs as an organism grows older.

question: One line of evidence against antagonistic pleiotropy is that
choice_A: Women who have more children tend to live longer
choice_B: Some animals show little or no senescence
choice_C: Even tissue cells with longer telomere strands can show senescence
choice_D: Exercise increases rather than decreases longevity
justification: Antagonistic pleiotropy is a theory that suggests that some genes may have beneficial effects early in life, but may have negative effects later in life. One line of evidence against this theory is that some animals show little or no senescence, meaning that they do not experience a decrease in their lifespan as they age. This suggests that the genes that are responsible for aging may not be as detrimental as previously thought. Therefore, the correct answer is (B).

question: The Kingbergs give us several keys to successful aging; which of the following is one that they did not name?
choice_A: Eat the correct food but not too much.
choice_C: Party at least once a month
justification: The Kingbergs give us several keys to successful aging, such as staying physically active, maintaining a positive attitude, staying socially connected, and engaging in meaningful activities. They did not mention partying at least once a month as a key to successful aging. Therefore, the correct answer is (C).

question: The initial length of telomere stand for members of a species is
choice_C: Dependent upon climate and time of year at birth
choice_D: Determined by parent diet and exercise
justification: The initial length of telomeres for members of a species is determined genetically. Telomeres are sections of DNA at the end of chromosomes that protect the genetic information from damage. The length of telomeres can vary from person to person, but the initial length is determined by the individual's genetic makeup.

question: In which country do most individuals choose to be cremated?
justification: The majority of individuals choose to be cremated in Japan. In Japan, cremation is the most common form of disposing of a deceased body, with over 99% of deceased individuals being cremated. In the U.S.A., cremation is becoming increasingly popular, but it is still not as common as in Japan. Kenya and Mexico have much lower rates of cremation than Japan.

question: Our social network refers to
choice_B: Those who are closest to us
choice_C: Those who we have not yet met
justification: Our social network refers to everyone we know, including family members, those who are closest to us, and even those who we have not yet met.

question: Which of the following appears to lower bad cholesterol?
justification: Niacin is a B vitamin that has been shown to lower bad cholesterol (LDL) and raise good cholesterol (HDL). Vitamin D, thiamine, and riboflavin are not known to have any effect on cholesterol levels.

question: A major difference between cancer cells and normal cells is that
choice_A: Cancer cells have no telomere strands
choice_B: Normal cells become cancerous when their telomere strands are used up
choice_C: Cancer cells have no upper limit on cell division
choice_D: Normal cells are protected from cancer when they have telomerase
justification: Cancer cells have no upper limit on cell division, meaning they can divide and replicate indefinitely. Normal cells, on the other hand, are limited in their ability to divide and replicate due to the shortening of their telomere strands. When the telomeres become too short, the cell can no longer divide and replicate. This is why telomerase, an enzyme that helps to maintain telomere length, is important in protecting normal cells from becoming cancerous.

question: The study of older adults and aging is referred to as
justification: The study of older adults and aging is referred to as Gerontology. Geropsychiatry is the study of mental health in older adults, Geriatrics is the branch of medicine that specializes in the care of older adults, and Gero-education is the study of educational programs and services for older adults.

question: Omega 3 appears to reduce the risk of
justification: Omega 3 fatty acids have been linked to a reduced risk of cardiovascular disease, but not to any of the other choices.

question: An example of a discontinuous change over the adult years is the change in
justification: An example of a discontinuous change over the adult years is the change in female hormone levels, which occurs during menopause. This is a sudden and dramatic change, as opposed to a gradual change.

question: Prospective memory refers to memory
choice_B: For something that happened a long time ago
choice_C: To do something in the future
choice_D: For the context and source of remembered information
justification: Prospective memory refers to memory for something that needs to be done in the future. It is the ability to remember to do something at a later time.

question: When asked where they would like to live for the rest of their lives most older adults say that they would prefer
choice_A: Moving to be close to their children
choice_B: Moving to Arizona or Florida if they could
choice_C: Residing in a very nice nursing home
justification: Most older adults prefer to stay in their own home for the rest of their lives. This is because they are familiar with their home and it is comfortable for them. Moving to be close to their children, moving to Arizona or Florida, or residing in a very nice nursing home are all other options, but they are not the most preferred option for most older adults.

question: Which of the following is an anti-oxidant?
justification: Vitamin E is an anti-oxidant that helps protect cells from damage caused by free radicals. It is found in foods such as nuts, seeds, and vegetable oils. Vitamin K, Vitamin B, and Vitamin X are not anti-oxidants.

question: Older adults are most likely to be involved in a traffic accident when they are
choice_C: A passenger in a younger person's car
justification: Older adults are most likely to be involved in a traffic accident when they are driving in a new location. This is because they may not be familiar with the roads and may not be able to react quickly to unexpected situations.

question: The suicide rate is highest for which of the following groups?
justification: According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), the highest suicide rate is among older white men, aged 85 and older. This group has the highest rate of suicide among all age and gender groups.

question: Which of the following does NOT usually occur to the lens of the eye as one grows older?
justification: The lens of the eye typically becomes thicker, yellows, and becomes clouded as one grows older. However, it does not usually fill with fluid. Therefore, the correct answer is (D).

question: The major question concerning aging and personality is:
choice_A: Do older adults still have personalities?
choice_C: Does personality decline as we grow older?
choice_D: Does personality increase of decrease with age?
justification: The major question concerning aging and personality is: Does personality change with age? This is the correct answer because it is the only option that directly addresses the question of how personality is affected by aging.

question: Benny is the head of a successful corporation. After a hard day at work during which he is under incredible pressure to perform well, he goes home to his wife who proceeds to spank him, tie him to their four poster bed, and tease him until he begs for intercourse. According to psychological theory, what is the most likely reason Benny finds this alluring?
choice_A: As a child be became sexually aroused pretending to be a powerful executive, so he now becomes aroused at work and must discharge this when he gets home.
choice_B: He is overcome with feelings of self doubt and his sadomasochistic behaviour allows him a safe outlet for that self doubt.
choice_C: He is overwhelmed with pressures and responsibilities at work, and the masochistic behaviour allows him to escape from being an autonomous, separate individual.
choice_D: He is secretly fascinated by violence and engaging in sadomasochistic behaviour is a relatively safe outlet for it.
justification: The most likely reason Benny finds this alluring is that he is secretly fascinated by violence and engaging in sadomasochistic behaviour is a relatively safe outlet for it. This is supported by psychological theory, which suggests that people may engage in masochistic behaviour as a way to cope with feelings of powerlessness or to escape from the pressures of autonomy and responsibility.

question: Bruce is a homosexual man. His friend Chuck is a heterosexual man. If we could have observed Bruce and Chuck as children we might have expected which of the following?
choice_A: Bruce likely participated in more female-typical play than Chuck.
choice_B: Bruce likely participated in more male-typical play than Chuck.
choice_C: Bruce and Chuck likely participated in more male-typical play than female-typical play.
choice_D: Bruce's father was more likely to have homosexual tendencies than Chuck's father.
justification: It is impossible to know for certain how Bruce and Chuck behaved as children, but research suggests that children's gender-typical play is related to their gender identity. Therefore, it is likely that Bruce participated in more female-typical play than Chuck, as Bruce is a homosexual man and Chuck is a heterosexual man.

question: According to the Ethnocultural Communities Facing AIDS study, single _________ men are more likely than single _________ to report having had more than one sexual partner in the previous year.
justification: According to the Ethnocultural Communities Facing AIDS study, single South Asian men are more likely than single English-speaking Caribbean men to report having had more than one sexual partner in the previous year.

question: Axl Tulip has a thin clear discharge coming from his penis and mild discomfort when he urinates. He is most likely suffering from _______ and should be treated with ________.
justification: Axl Tulip is most likely suffering from chlamydia and should be treated with tetracycline. Chlamydia is a common sexually transmitted infection (STI) caused by the bacteria Chlamydia trachomatis. Symptoms of chlamydia include a thin clear discharge from the penis and mild discomfort when urinating. Treatment for chlamydia is typically with antibiotics, such as tetracycline.

question: Buffy and Willow were discussing their sexual fantasies. Buffy revealed that she sometimes fantasizes about sex with other women even though she normally finds herself attracted to men. She also fantasizes about group sex. Which of the following statements can be inferred from Buffy's fantasies?
choice_A: Buffy's fantasies suggest that she must be a latent homosexual or bisexual.
choice_B: Buffy's fantasies are indicative of a paraphilia.
choice_C: Buffy's fantasies indicate that she is not getting enough sex to keep her satisfied.
choice_D: Buffy's fantasies are fairly typical and tell us little about her sexual tendencies.
justification: Buffy's fantasies do not necessarily indicate that she is a latent homosexual or bisexual, nor do they necessarily indicate that she has a paraphilia. Additionally, her fantasies do not necessarily indicate that she is not getting enough sex to keep her satisfied. Rather, Buffy's fantasies are fairly typical and tell us little about her sexual tendencies. Therefore, the correct answer is (D).

question: What are the experiences when a sexual addict has completed the sexual act?
choice_A: (s)he experiences feelings of hopelessness and despair
choice_B: (s)he uses the fantasy of the behaviour just completed to become aroused again
choice_D: (s)he immediately becomes sexually aroused again and feels good about the behaviour
justification: A sexual addict typically experiences feelings of guilt, shame, and emptiness after completing the sexual act. These feelings can lead to feelings of hopelessness and despair. The addict may also use the fantasy of the behaviour just completed to become aroused again, but this is not a typical experience. (S)he does not usually feel relaxed and emotionally relieved, nor does (s)he immediately become sexually aroused again and feel good about the behaviour.

question: Ovaries and testes
justification: All of the choices are correct. Ovaries and testes are homologous organs, meaning they have similar structures and functions. They both produce gametes, which are reproductive cells, and they both produce sex hormones, which are responsible for the development of secondary sex characteristics.

question: According to John Money, __________ refers to a person's private internal sense of maleness or femaleness.
justification: The correct answer is (A) Gender identity. According to John Money, gender identity refers to a person's private internal sense of maleness or femaleness. This is distinct from gender roles, which are the behaviors and activities that are socially expected of a person based on their gender.

question: In men gonorrhea and chlamydia most often infect the:
justification: In men, gonorrhea and chlamydia most often infect the urethra, which is the tube that carries urine from the bladder to the outside of the body.

question: What day of a typical 28-day menstrual cycle is a woman likely to ovulate?
justification: The average menstrual cycle is 28 days long, and ovulation typically occurs around day 14 of the cycle. This means that a woman is most likely to ovulate on day 14 of her menstrual cycle.

question: Which of the following changes is NOT associated with menopause?
choice_A: the walls of the vagina become thick
justification: The walls of the vagina do not change during menopause. However, the other choices are all associated with menopause, as the production of estrogen declines, the vagina shrinks in length, and the labia minora shrink.

question: The official condemnation by the Catholic Church of artificial birth control is set forth in _______ encyclical called Humanae Vitae.
justification: The official condemnation by the Catholic Church of artificial birth control is set forth in Pope Paul VI's encyclical called Humanae Vitae.

question: Before the Masters and Johnson research, it was thought that vaginal lubrication was due to secretions of
justification: The Masters and Johnson research revealed that vaginal lubrication is due to secretions of the Bartholin glands. Cowper's gland is responsible for producing a clear fluid that lubricates the urethra, prostate gland produces a milky fluid that helps to nourish and protect sperm, and the adrenal gland produces hormones that regulate the body's metabolism.

question: What sexual act is prohibited in most societies?
choice_D: sex with a non-spouse if the person is married.
justification: The answer is (D) sex with a non-spouse if the person is married. This is because most societies have laws prohibiting adultery, which is defined as engaging in sexual activity with someone other than one's spouse. Masturbation, incest, and sex during menstruation are not typically prohibited in most societies.

question: The placenta does all of the following except:
justification: The placenta is an organ that develops in the uterus during pregnancy. It is a temporary organ that connects the mother and fetus and is responsible for supplying oxygen, nutrients, and blood to the fetus. It does not, however, secrete hormones.

question: When a woman thinks that she probably is a lesbian, she is at the:
justification: When a woman is questioning her sexuality and is unsure if she is a lesbian, she is in the confusion stage. This is a stage of self-exploration and discovery, where she is trying to understand her feelings and identity. The other stages are pride (where she is proud of her identity), tolerance (where she is comfortable with her identity and is tolerant of others), and acceptance (where she is fully accepting of her identity).

question: Castration in adulthood
choice_A: will produce a high voice because of decreased testosterone production.
choice_B: will produce a high voice because of the pain that accompanies the procedure.
choice_C: will not produce a high voice because the larynx has already grown.
choice_D: will not produce a high voice because castration does not affect testosterone production.
justification: Castration in adulthood will not produce a high voice because the larynx has already grown and castration does not affect testosterone production.

question: __________, an odorous steroid that is well documented as a pheremone in pigs, has been isolated in the underarm sweat of humans.
justification: Androstenol is a steroid hormone found in the underarm sweat of humans. It is an odorous steroid that is well documented as a pheromone in pigs. The other choices are not related to this question.

question: Bill is a successful ad executive for a computer company. He is 32 married and the father of two children. When Bill's wife is not home he puts on her satin stockings garter belt bra skirt blouse and red stilettos. While dressing he becomes sexually excited and proceeds to masturbate. Which of the following descriptions best fits Bill?
justification: Bill is a transvestite, which is someone who derives sexual pleasure from dressing in clothing typically associated with the opposite gender. Transvestites are not necessarily transgender, which is a term used to describe someone whose gender identity does not match the sex they were assigned at birth. Drag queens and female impersonators are performers who dress in clothing typically associated with the opposite gender for entertainment purposes. Transsexuals are people who have undergone gender reassignment surgery and/or hormone therapy to transition to the gender they identify with.

question: IUD use has been linked with which of the following
justification: IUD use has been linked with all of the above, including pelvic inflammatory disease, tubal infections, and uterine infections.

question: People who cannot reach orgasm without touching a woman's shoe would certainly be considered sexually abnormal or deviant by which of the following definitions?
justification: The definition of sexual abnormality or deviance is typically based on psychological criteria, so the correct answer is (A) psychological.

question: Mike and Carol have been married for 5 years. Recently Mike has found that although he wants to have sex with Carol he has trouble getting aroused. However he does not have trouble getting aroused when he sees his secretary at work. Which of the following describe(s) Mike's dysfunction?
choice_A: Mike suffers from a global dysfunction.
choice_D: Mike must be having an affair with his secretary.
justification: Mike is experiencing erectile dysfunction, which is defined as difficulty getting or maintaining an erection. This is not necessarily a sign of an affair, but rather a sign of a physical or psychological issue.

question: The average male genital size is approximately
justification: The average male genital size is approximately 5 inches when erect.

question: Which of the following is removed when a male is circumcised?
justification: Circumcision is the surgical removal of the foreskin, also known as the prepuce, from the penis. The foreskin is a fold of skin that covers the head of the penis. The other choices are not removed during circumcision.

question: Mini-pills contain:
justification: Mini-pills contain only progestin, which is a synthetic form of the hormone progesterone. They do not contain any estrogen or other hormones.

question: The environment for sperm passage is most hospitable just at
justification: The environment for sperm passage is most hospitable just at preovulation, which is the time just before the ovary releases an egg. During preovulation, the cervical mucus is thin and watery, allowing sperm to easily pass through the cervix and into the uterus.

question: The onset (the very beginning) of labor is first triggered by
choice_A: hormones secreted by the Mother's ovaries
choice_B: hormones secreted by the Mother's hypothalamus
choice_C: hormones secreted by the fetus' adrenal gland
choice_D: the placenta and uterus secretion of prostaglandins
justification: The onset of labor is first triggered by the placenta and uterus secretion of prostaglandins, which are hormones that cause the uterus to contract and the cervix to soften and dilate. Prostaglandins are not secreted by the Mother's ovaries, hypothalamus, or the fetus' adrenal gland.

question: Freud said that the penis first becomes the major focus of pleasure-seeking at:
justification: Freud believed that the penis first becomes the major focus of pleasure-seeking during the phallic stage of psychosexual development, which occurs between the ages of 3 and 6. During this stage, the child's libido (sexual energy) is focused on the genitals, and the child begins to recognize the differences between males and females.

question: An anatomical difference between males and females is:
choice_A: males have one exit structure for urine and reproductive fluids, whereas females have two
choice_B: males have an external sexual organ that gets engorged with blood, whereas females do not
choice_C: males have many times the number of nerve endings in the penis that females have in the clitoris.
justification: The correct answer is (D) all of the above.
